title: Academic Research Instrument Cognitive Load Assessor
description: Analyze your multi-section survey draft and participant demographics to assess cognitive load per section. Receive detailed cognitive load scores and basic recommendations to optimize question complexity and survey structure, improving respondent completion and data quality.
inputLabel: Paste your survey instrument draft text here or upload a survey draft file (JSON or text). Optionally, enter participant demographic details and upload pilot feedback data to enhance assessment.
outputLabel: Cognitive Load Assessment Results and Recommendations
systemPrompt: You are an expert assistant specialized in academic survey design, focused on analyzing survey drafts and participant demographic data to compute cognitive load scores per survey section. You provide detailed, section-by-section cognitive load breakdowns and clear recommendations for reducing question complexity or ambiguity and improving survey structure to minimize respondent fatigue. Refuse to provide medical or psychological diagnoses. Reject inputs that are malicious, incomplete, or violate privacy. Ensure recommendations are explainable, transparent, and respect user privacy. If inputs are malformed or incomplete, return partial scores with warnings. Output results as plain text with optional structured JSON if requested. Enforce strict validation on input survey structure and demographics. Do not rewrite questions without explicit user approval. Always maintain confidentiality and avoid bias by considering demographic tailoring.

presets.label: Balanced Assessment
presets.prompt: Analyze the uploaded survey draft and provided demographic profile to compute cognitive load scores per section. Provide a detailed breakdown and actionable recommendations for question simplification and survey structure optimization. Include warnings for any detected issues in survey completeness or demographic conflicts.
presets.hint: Use for a comprehensive but balanced cognitive load analysis with clear recommendations.

presets.label: Quick Scan
presets.prompt: Perform a quick cognitive load assessment of the provided survey draft and demographics. Focus on identifying sections with highest cognitive burden and suggest basic improvements. Provide concise output suitable for rapid iteration.
presets.hint: Good for fast feedback on draft surveys with minimal input.

presets.label: Demographic Impact Focus
presets.prompt: Assess cognitive load emphasizing the impact of participant demographics (age, education, language proficiency). Highlight how these factors influence complexity and suggest tailored revisions to reduce cognitive burden for the target population.
presets.hint: Use when demographic tailoring is critical.

presets.label: Pilot Data Integration
presets.prompt: Integrate provided pilot survey response data and feedback in the cognitive load assessment. Adjust scores and recommendations based on observed participant difficulties and dropout risks indicated by the pilot data. Warn if pilot data is incompatible or incomplete.
presets.hint: Use when pilot data is available to inform assessment.

jsonSchemaHint: Output cognitive load assessment includes overallScore (number), sectionScores (object mapping section names to scores and explanations), and recommendations (array of actionable suggestions). Include warnings array if applicable.
clarifyPrompt: Please provide your survey draft text or upload a file, along with participant demographic details (age range, education level, language proficiency). Optionally, upload pilot feedback data to enhance assessment. Ensure the survey draft includes sections and questions with clear structure.
finalizePrompt: Based on the uploaded survey draft and demographics, generate a detailed cognitive load assessment with section-by-section scores and actionable recommendations. If pilot data is provided, integrate it to refine scores. Highlight any warnings or data issues explicitly.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Instrument Cognitive Load Balancer

niche.scenario: Designing multi-section survey instruments or questionnaires that optimize participant cognitive load to improve data quality and respondent completion rates.

idea.problem: Academic researchers designing complex multi-section survey instruments struggle to balance question complexity, length, and respondent cognitive load, often leading to participant fatigue, dropouts, and lower data quality. Existing tools focus on content or formatting but do not quantitatively assess or optimize cognitive burden across instrument sections.
inputs: Survey instrument draft text (sections and questions)
Target participant demographic info (age range, education level, language proficiency)
Maximum acceptable survey length or completion time
Optional prior survey response data or pilot feedback
outputs: Section-by-section cognitive load assessment scores with detailed breakdowns
Recommendations for question revisions to reduce complexity or ambiguity
Optimized survey structure balancing question difficulty, length, and order to minimize fatigue
Visual dashboard tracking cognitive load distribution and predicted completion rates
whyItWins: Addresses a critical but under-served aspect of survey design: cognitive load management tailored to participant demographics
Supports iterative refinement with quantitative metrics rather than subjective judgments, improving data validity
Combines linguistic complexity analysis, question type impact, and pilot feedback integration for holistic optimization
Clear upgrade path from simple single-page assessment to multi-page instrument builder with AI-assisted rewrite suggestions and longitudinal tracking

upgradePath.today: Single-page tool analyzing uploaded survey drafts to produce cognitive load scores and basic recommendations per section.
upgradePath.in90Days: Interactive multi-section survey builder integrating live cognitive load feedback, question rewriting suggestions, and demographic impact simulations.
upgradePath.in12Months: Full-featured survey instrument design platform with team collaboration, pilot data import, automated adaptive survey structuring, and integration with data collection platforms for real-time cognitive load and dropout monitoring.

riskNotes: Must avoid over-reliance on automated linguistic complexity metrics without human validation.
Ensure privacy and confidentiality for uploaded survey drafts and pilot data.
Do not provide medical or psychological diagnoses; strictly cognitive load estimation for survey design.
Avoid bias by allowing customization for diverse participant populations.

blueprint.summary: A platform for academic researchers to design and optimize multi-section survey instruments by quantitatively assessing and balancing participant cognitive load, tailored to demographic factors, to improve data quality and completion rates.
successMetrics: Increased survey completion rates in pilot studies
Reduction in participant dropout attributed to cognitive load
User adoption and frequency of iterative survey refinements
Positive user feedback on recommendation relevance and usability
Integration and usage of demographic tailoring features

components.name: Cognitive Load Dashboard UI
components.responsibility: Display section-by-section cognitive load scores, visualizations, and recommendations; provide interactive survey builder interface with live feedback.
notes: Must support multi-section survey visualization and editing.
Include accessibility features for diverse users.
Allow export of reports and visualizations.

components.name: Cognitive Load Assessment API
components.responsibility: Analyze survey text and demographic inputs to compute cognitive load scores per section, integrating linguistic complexity metrics, question type impact, and pilot feedback data.
notes: Must allow customization for demographic adjustments to avoid bias.
Provide detailed breakdowns to support recommendations.
Handle incomplete or malformed survey drafts gracefully.

components.name: Question Revision and Optimization API
components.responsibility: Generate actionable recommendations to reduce question complexity or ambiguity and suggest optimized survey structures balancing difficulty, length, and order.
notes: Recommendations should be explainable and transparent.
Avoid over-reliance on automated suggestions; flag uncertain cases.
Support iterative refinement workflows.

components.name: Survey Instrument Data Store
components.responsibility: Persist survey drafts, section and question metadata, and optimized survey versions.
notes: Ensure data privacy and encryption at rest.
Support versioning for iterative survey design.
Store question types and complexity annotations.

components.name: Participant Demographics Data Store
components.responsibility: Store target participant demographic profiles used for cognitive load tailoring and simulation.
notes: Allow flexible demographic attributes (age range, education, language proficiency).
Support multiple demographic profiles per survey.

components.name: Pilot Survey Response and Feedback Store
components.responsibility: Persist optional prior survey response data and pilot feedback to inform cognitive load adjustments and validation.
notes: Ensure confidentiality and anonymization of pilot data.
Support import from common survey platforms.
Enable linkage to specific survey versions.

components.name: Background Cognitive Load Recalculation Job
components.responsibility: Periodically recalculate cognitive load scores and recommendations when surveys or demographics are updated or new pilot data is imported.
notes: Handle large surveys efficiently with batching.
Notify users of updated results.
Retry on transient failures.

components.name: Survey Platform Integration
components.responsibility: Import pilot response data from external survey platforms and export optimized survey instruments for deployment.
notes: Support common platforms like Qualtrics, SurveyMonkey.
Ensure secure API authentication and data transfer.
Handle data format inconsistencies.

backgroundJobs.name: Recalculate Cognitive Load Scores
backgroundJobs.trigger: On survey draft update, demographic profile change, or pilot data import
backgroundJobs.purpose: Automatically update cognitive load assessments and recommendations to reflect latest data.

edgeCases: Malformed or incomplete survey drafts missing sections or questions.
Demographic profiles with missing or conflicting attributes.
Pilot data incompatible with current survey version or format.
Surveys with extremely long or complex questions causing processing delays.
User uploads containing sensitive or confidential information requiring strict privacy controls.
Automated recommendations that conflict or suggest contradictory changes.
Network or service failures during background job execution or external platform integrations.
nonGoals: Providing medical or psychological diagnoses or assessments.
Replacing human judgment in survey content validity or ethical considerations.
Real-time participant monitoring during survey administration.
Full-scale survey deployment or data collection platform functionality.
Automated rewriting of questions without user review and approval.

dataFlow: User authenticates and accesses the platform pages requiring authentication.
On '/' (Survey Upload & Initial Assessment), user uploads survey draft and demographic profiles and optionally pilot data.
The frontend sends survey data to /api/survey/upload to store the survey draft and metadata.
Demographic profiles and pilot data are stored via respective API endpoints (/api/pilot-feedback/import).
After upload, frontend calls /api/cognitive-load/assess with surveyId, surveyVersion, and demographicProfileId to compute cognitive load scores.
Cognitive Load Assessment API fetches survey data, demographics, and pilot feedback from data stores, computes scores, and returns detailed breakdowns.
Frontend displays cognitive load scores and basic recommendations on the upload page.
On '/builder', user edits survey sections and questions and selects demographic profiles.

Frontend sends updated survey data to backend (via /api/survey/upload or dedicated update endpoint) and requests live cognitive load assessment and recommendations via /api/cognitive-load/assess and /api/recommendations/generate.
Recommendations API uses cognitive load data and survey structure to generate actionable, explainable suggestions.
Dashboard UI visualizes section-by-section cognitive load, recommendations, and allows export of reports.
On '/pilot-data', user imports pilot response data via /api/pilot-feedback/import, which stores anonymized feedback linked to survey versions.
Background job triggers on survey, demographic, or pilot data changes to recalculate cognitive load scores and recommendations asynchronously, notifying users upon completion.
On '/reports', users select survey and version to view detailed cognitive load reports and export them in PDF or JSON formats.
validationRules: SurveyInstrument must have non-empty title, at least one section, and each section must have at least one question.
Survey sections and questions JSON must conform to defined schema including question types and complexity annotations.
DemographicProfile attributes must be consistent; ageRange should be a valid range string, educationLevel and languageProficiency from predefined sets if provided.
PilotFeedback responseData must match the survey structure and version; reject incompatible or malformed data.
API request bodies must include required fields and valid types; reject requests missing surveyId, surveyVersion, or user authentication.
Uploaded files for surveys and pilot data must be scanned for malicious content and size limits enforced.
Cognitive Load API must handle incomplete or partial survey drafts gracefully, returning partial scores with warnings.
Recommendations API must validate input cognitive load data and flag uncertain or conflicting suggestions.
Background job inputs must be validated to avoid processing invalid or outdated survey versions.
errorHandling: API routes return standardized error responses with HTTP status codes and error messages (e.g., 400 for validation errors, 401 for auth failures, 500 for server errors).
Malformed or incomplete survey drafts result in partial processing with warnings returned in response details.
Demographic profile conflicts or missing attributes return warnings but allow processing with default assumptions.
Pilot data incompatible with current survey version triggers error response with instructions to reconcile versions.
Background jobs implement retry logic on transient failures with exponential backoff and log errors for manual review.
Network or service failures during external integrations return informative error messages and queue retry attempts.
Frontend displays user-friendly error messages and guidance for corrective actions on API failures.
Sensitive data errors trigger audit logging and alerting for security review.
securityNotes: All API routes require user authentication and authorization to access or modify survey data.
Data privacy enforced by encrypting sensitive data at rest in the database.
Pilot feedback data is anonymized before storage to protect participant confidentiality.
File uploads are scanned for malware and validated for allowed types and sizes.
API authentication tokens and session cookies use secure, HttpOnly, and SameSite flags.
Access control restricts survey data visibility to ownerUserId and authorized collaborators.
External survey platform integrations use secure API authentication and encrypted data transfer.
Audit logging implemented for critical operations including data uploads, updates, and background job executions.
Recommendations avoid automated rewriting without explicit user approval to maintain ethical standards.

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user uploads a valid survey draft and demographic profile on the '/' page
acceptanceTests.when: The user submits the upload form
acceptanceTests.then: The survey is stored, cognitive load scores are computed and displayed, and basic recommendations are shown without errors

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user edits survey sections and questions on the '/builder' page
acceptanceTests.then: Updated cognitive load scores and real-time recommendations are returned and displayed accurately reflecting the edits

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user imports pilot feedback data via the '/pilot-data' page
acceptanceTests.then: Pilot data is stored linked to the correct survey version, cognitive load assessments are updated, and impact summaries are shown

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user views the '/reports' page and selects a survey and version
acceptanceTests.then: Detailed cognitive load reports and recommendations are displayed and export files (PDF, JSON) are generated without errors

acceptanceTests.given: A malformed survey draft missing sections is uploaded
acceptanceTests.then: The API returns a validation error with descriptive messages, and the frontend displays user-friendly guidance

acceptanceTests.given: Demographic profile with conflicting attributes is submitted
acceptanceTests.when: The cognitive load assessment is requested
acceptanceTests.then: The system processes with warnings about conflicts and applies default assumptions, returning partial results

acceptanceTests.given: Background job triggers after survey update
acceptanceTests.then: Cognitive load scores and recommendations are recalculated correctly, users are notified, and failures are retried or logged

acceptanceTests.given: User attempts to access API routes without authentication
acceptanceTests.then: The API returns 401 Unauthorized errors and no data is exposed

Develop Cognitive Load Assessment API (/api/cognitive-load/assess) integrating survey, demographics, and pilot data
Develop Recommendations API (/api/recommendations/generate) consuming cognitive load data
Build frontend pages: '/' for upload and initial assessment with forms and results display
Build '/builder' page with interactive survey editing, live feedback, and dashboard visualization
Build '/pilot-data' page for pilot data import and management
Build '/reports' page for detailed report viewing and export functionality
Implement background job system for recalculating cognitive load and recommendations with triggers and notifications
Integrate external survey platform import/export with secure API authentication
Add accessibility features and export options (PDF, JSON) in dashboard UI
Implement error handling, logging, and retry mechanisms across APIs and background jobs
Conduct acceptance testing and iterate based on feedback
